channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How did Elon Musk's Starlink become so dominant in the market?
item.description: The team from NPR's "Planet Money" looks at Elon Musk's Starlink and its big lead in the satellite internet market. Can it stay ahead of its competito...

item.title: 17 everyday people share what freedom means to them in today's America
item.description: This Independence Day, NPR wanted to know how the freedoms and ideals of the U.S. have been on readers' minds.

item.title: States may meet federal deadline on new Colorado River water-sharing deal
item.description: About 40 million people rely on the Colorado River for drinking water. It also irrigates agricultural fields. It's also shrinking. Now, states might a...

item.title: What freedom means to NPR readers. And, the secret to a perfect July 4 pasta salad
item.description: It's the Fourth of July, and to commemorate the holiday, the Up First newsletter asked readers to share what freedom means to them. And, this one secr...

item.title: Why is the dollar off to a weak start this year?
item.description: The U.S. dollar had its worst start this year in more than half a century. Harvard University economics professor Kenneth Rogoff says President Trump ...

item.title: US expands militarized zones to 1/3 of southern border, stirring controversy
'I don't know who to trust anymore': Druze worry about being left behind in post-war Syria
item.description: Recent attacks on the religious minority in Damascus have fuelled growing distrust towards the state.

item.title: Musk vows to start a new political party. Here's why that's harder than it sounds.
item.description: Billionaire Elon Musk is floating a new political party dubbed the "America Party" — but the idea could face major hurdles.

item.title: Hegseth slams Iran strikes initial assessment that contradicts Trump's take
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth pushed back against an initial intelligence assessment that differed from President Trump's announcement on the results...

item.title: Watch: French police wade into sea to slash migrant 'taxi-boat'
item.description: The BBC's Andrew Harding saw French gendarmes using knives to slash an inflatable small boat, packed with men, women and children.

item.title: BBC on French beach as police slash migrant 'taxi-boat' heading to UK
item.description: Watch video of French police destroying a boat in the English Channel in a rare and unusual intervention, which police have made clear is not a new ta...

item.title: Notorious Swedish crime boss arrested 1,600 miles away
item.description: Ismael Abdo is one of Sweden's most wanted criminals and the subject of an international arrest warrant since 2024.

item.title: DNA evidence leads to murder indictment 42 years after woman's disappearance
item.description: Teresa Peroni was 27 years old when she disappeared on or around July 4, 1983, in Selma, Oregon. She was last seen with her then-boyfriend Mark Sanfra...

item.title: Israel's strike on bustling Gaza cafe killed a Hamas operative - but dozens more people were killed
item.description: The attack raises more questions over whether Israel’s use of force is proportionate, as required by international law.

item.title: Trump to sign "big, beautiful bill" in July Fourth ceremony at White House
item.description: President Trump is hosting a celebratory event at the White House to sign his "one big, beautiful bill."

item.title: Hamas says it is consulting other Palestinian groups on Gaza ceasefire plan
item.description: The US president says he expects to know soon whether Hamas has agreed to a proposal for a 60-day truce.

item.title: A volunteer finds the Holy Grail of abolitionist-era Baptist documents in Massachusetts
item.description: A volunteer searching the archives of the American Baptist in Massachusetts has found a nearly 180-year-old document shedding light on the church’s su...

item.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs’ lawyers say he is a changed man. Will that spare him from more time behind bars?
